original_comment:
THIS ALBUM IS ONE OF THE BEST THINGS POP MUSIC HAS EVER GIVEN ME.
She expresses the urgency of the third world agenda with such excellence that makes me cry of happiness. ABSOLUTELY ahead of her time. Being from Brasil, it was the first time I could see someone from out of Latin America express anything about my country with such accuracy. It was no offensive caricature. I guess it was so accurate because it was the first time I was not seeing an Imperialistic overview of my culture. There is a bigger degree of understanding when it's between citizens of two countries that have been very explored by Europe and North America throughout History.

And it's funny because I was a kid at the time and I already felt it! I did not know what Imperialism was in theory, but I knew for my experience. So, I got to listen to her music and got in touch with this kind of discourse. Arular started that third-world revolutionary empowerment in my early teenage years. Thanks M.I.A. <3
cleaned_comment: album one best things pop music ever given meshe expresses urgency third world agenda excellence makes cry happiness absolutely ahead time brasil first time could see someone latin america express anything country accuracy offensive caricature guess accurate first time seeing imperialistic overview culture bigger degree understanding citizens two countries explored europe north america throughout historyand funny kid time already felt know imperialism theory knew experience got listen music got touch kind discourse arular started thirdworld revolutionary empowerment early teenage years thanks mia lt
